title.en: Lithuanian for Beginners I, Level 0 - A1.1
title.et: Leedu keel algtasemele I, tase 0 - A1.1

faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

name.en: Department of Languages of the Baltic Region

structural_unit_name.en: Department of Languages of the Baltic Region

description.en:
During the course basic grammar knowledge is given through a range of activities and exercises e.g. reading texts on a variety of topics listed below and listening to dialogues. Communicative approach is used in teaching speaking and listening skills. 
The topics covered during the course: 
- Languages, countries, nationalities
- Town, address, occupation
- Family, relatives
- Numbers, colours
- Food and beverages, in a shop, in a cafe
- Time
- Transport, bus station, taxi
- Location
Students are also given a brief overview of the main aspects of Lithuanian culture and everyday life.
description.et:
Kursuse jooksul omandatakse grammatika baasteadmised, loetakse lihtsamaid tekste, kuulatakse dialooge, arendatakse kommunikatiivse meetodi abil  rääkimisoskust. 
Teemad: 
- Keeled, maad, rahvused
- Linn, aadress, ametid
- Pere, sugulased 
- Numbrid, värvid
- Söögid ja joogid, poes, kohvikus
- Kellaaeg
- Transport, bussijaam, takso
- Asukoht.
Samas antakse lühiülevaade leedulaste tänapäevasest eluolust, tavadest ja kultuurist.

objectives.en: A course in Lithuanian for Beginners is  for those students who do not speak Lithuanian or have only minimal knowledge. The aim of the course is to give basic knowledge of Lithuanian and to develop all four language skills (reading, writing, listening, speaking) through a variety of tasks.
objectives.et: Leedu keele algkursus on mõeldud üliõpilastele, kes ei oska üldse või oskavad minimaalselt leedu keelt. Kursuse eesmärk on anda algteadmisi leedu keelest, arendades erinevate tegevuste kaudu nelja osaoskust (lugemine, kirjutamine, kuulamine, rääkimine).

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course the student is able to understand simple written and oral texts in Lithuanian and to use the vocabulary and grammar covered during the course in simple everyday communication situations.
learning_outcomes.et: Pärast kursuse läbimist suudab üliõpilane aru saada lihtsamatest leedukeelsetest tekstidest ja leedukeelsest kõnest, oskab kasutada õpitud sõnavara ja grammatikat lihtsamates igapäevastes suhtlussituatsioonides.

grade_preconditions.et:
1) hand in all home assignments
2) pass 4 coverage tests.
Grading is done according to the following system: A (91-100%); B (81-90%); C (71-80%); D (61-70%); E (51-60%)
3) participate in at least 75% of the classes.

grade_evaluation.et:
1) homeworks - 5%
2) 4 tests - 80 % (20% + 20% + 20% + 20%)
3) oral exam (dialogue with a coursemate) - 15%

debt_elimination.et: Upon the agreement with a lecturer. All debts must be settled by 22.12.2017.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
Tunnis antav materjal ja/või käsilehed.
Teaching material provided by the lecturer and handouts.
resources.recommended_materials:
1. E. Petrasiuniene, A. Valanciauskiene, V. Naslenaite-Eberhardt, K. Jakaite-Bulbukiene, L. Vaskeviciene "Langas i lietuviu kalba" (Vilnius 2016)
2. R. Zukiene "Lietuviu kalba uzsienieciams: teorija ir praktika. Lithuanian Course for Foreigners: Theory and Practice" (VGTU leidykla Technika 2012)
